photo.title: Nightscape - Downtown San Francisco - 20131209

description._content: A spectacular evening view from the Grand Club, 32nd floor of the Grand Hyatt San Francisco. The Transamerica Pyramid, the tallest building in San Francisco and topped with a blue light, is prominent near the left edge. The tall building to its right is "555 California Street", and it is an artifact of my viewpoint that it appears to be taller than the Transamerica Pyramid. The building with twin pink and blue flag poles is "345 California Street". The 4 buildings of the Embarcadero Center are evident with their outlines highlighted with lights. Way below on the right is the traffic moving along Sutter Street. www.transamericapyramidcenter.com/ www.emporis.com/building/555californiastreet-sanfrancisco... www.emporis.com/building/345californiacenter-sanfrancisco... www.emporis.com/building/four-embarcadero-center-san-fran... San Francisco, California, USA. iPhone 5s - Photographs taken with the camera on an iPhone 5s. PureShot - A series of 3 images captured with different exposure settings. MobileHDR - The 3 input images were combined into an HDR composite image. HandyPhoto - Some minor internal reflections from the window glass retouched. Snapseed - HDR filter applied. Leonardo - Trapezoidal crop applied to alter the apparent perspective. Noise Reduction and Sharpening filters applied. Overall lighting adjustments applied. ExifEditor - EXIF data from one of the original images transferred to the final image. (Filed as 20131222_iPadMiniRetina 001 PureShot-MobileHDR-HandyPhoto-Snapseed-Leonardo-ExifEditor.JPG)

photo.title: 555 California Street, Financial District, San Francisco, Ca. USA

description._content: Designed by Pietro Belluschi (with the firms Wurster, Bernardi & Emmons and Skidmore, Owings & Merrill) and opened in 1969 as the world headquarters of Bank of America, the 237m-tall, 52-story (four underground) skyscraper is San Francisco's second tallest building. Compared to the tallest, the nearby Transamerica Pyramid, from viewpoints around the city, this still seems the more substantial building – its floor area of 167,225 m² is drastically greater than the Pyramid's 46,452 m² and the fact that the entire block, even including the sidewalks, is clad in dark carnelian granite gives it a strong presence. Yet it's far from monolithic – I was inspired to take this photo by the way the brown building magically faded into the blue sky, and the lines created by columns of bay windows (apparently a reference to basalt columns, the city's vernacular architecture, and a stack of pencils) lead the eye irresistibly upwards. You might like to view larger versions of this image, as reflections in the polished granite and tinted windows of the upper floors create attractive lattice patterns. Better On Black?

photo.title: Transamerica Pyramid

description._content: View On Black The Transamerica Pyramid is the tallest skyscraper in the San Francisco skyline and one of its most iconic. Although the building no longer houses the headquarters of the Transamerica Corporation, it is still strongly associated with the company and is depicted in the company's logo. Designed by architect William Pereira and built by Hathaway Dinwiddie Construction Company, at 260 m (850 ft), upon completion in 1972 it was among the five tallest buildings in the world. The tower has no public access except for the first floor lobby, thus visitors cannot ascend to the top for a panoramic view.

photo.title: Above San Francisco

description._content: Here is another photo from the top of 555 California Street. I really liked this angle because it incorporates so many familiar spots from around the Bay Area. You have Downtown San Francisco in the foreground, the Bay Bridge with some light trails, a ferry departing the ferry building, Treasure Island, the new portion of the Bay Bridge, and Mt. Diablo peeking out from behind the East Bay Hills. What a night! View my website: www.danielpivnick.com

description._content: Photos of earlier N30 rally and march www.flickr.com/photos/ari/sets/72157622914061974/ 22 people were arrested at the Bank of America building west.actforclimatejustice.org/2009/11/n30-international-d... dirtymoney.org 350.org beyondtalk.net Protest at Chevron HQ in San Ramon on Dec 7, 2009 west.actforclimatejustice.org/2009/11/december-7th-tell-c... Copenhagen Cafe is a place to gather Dec 7 - 18 during the climate conference for live coverage and workshops. Ground level Crocker Galleria, 50 Post St More info & schedule at carboncollaborative.org/?q=copenhagen-cafe 350 weekend of action Dec 11-13 at the mid-point of Coppenhagen. See www.350.org/map for more Bay Area events Friday December 11 Meet in front of Senator Feinstein's office on the corner of Post & Montgomery at 4 pm What: First, we'll deliver 350 photos from Oct. 24th and letters from participating groups to Senator Feinstein office (a delivery to Senator Boxer's office will happen earlier in the day). Then we'll have a candlelight vigil and march from Senator Feinstein's office to the Civic Center. At the Civic Center there will be speakers and we will also spell out 350 with our candles for a photo. The vigil is 5:30 - 7 pm, San Francisco City Hall Saturday December 12th The World wants a real deal Santas, elves, & reindeer will also gather to collect signatures on giant holiday cards asking for a real climate deal in Copenhagen. description._content: 555 California Street is currently the second tallest building in San Francisco, although it will fall down a few rungs when projects in progress are completed. It was the tallest in San Francisco when completed, but was surpassed by the Transamerica Pyramid, which is nearby on Montgomery Street. California Street is the wide street in the image. It runs from Embarcadero Center west through the Financial District, Chinatown and crests on Nob Hill. It's a steep climb uphill, but there is a cable car that runs along California Street. photo.title: Bank Of America Building

description._content:
The only way I could take this shot was by lying down, no tripod and looking straight up. Oh well, the ludicrous things we do to get a good picture!

555 California Street, formerly Bank of America Center, is a 52-story, 779 ft (237.4 m) skyscraper in San Francisco, California. It is the second tallest building in the city and a focal point of the Financial District. Completed in 1969, the tower served as the world headquarters of Bank of America until the 1998 merger with NationsBank, when company moved its headquarters to Charlotte, North Carolina.

Floor count         52
Floor area1,500,000 sq ft 
Elevators38

The skyscraper incorporates thousands of bay windows thanks to its unique design, meant to improve the rental value and to symbolize the bay windows common in San Francisco residential real estate. 

At the north foot of the skyscraper is a large plaza named in honor of Bank of America founder A.P. Giannini that is often shaded during the day, leading to it being criticized as cold and windswept by many.

Within the plaza is the 200-ton black Swedish granite sculpture "Transcendence" by Masayuki Nagare that, while resembling a liver, is locally and derisively known as the "Banker's Heart." 

Nearly the entire block—the skyscraper, the banking hall, the plaza, the stairways, and the sidewalks—is clad in costly polished or rough carnelian granite. An exclusive restaurant, the "Carnelian Room", is located on the 52nd floor. The elevator to this restaurant is one of the few publicly accessible high-speed elevators in San Francisco. Due in large part to the late–2000s economic recession, however, the restaurant closed at midnight New Year's Eve, 2009.[5]

In 1971, 555 California Street, then just two years old, was featured at the beginning of the film Dirty Harry. It was from the roof of the building that the killer shoots his victim in the pool atop what is currently the Hilton Financial District hotel on Kearny Street. The film shows wide panoramic views of San Francisco taken from the roof of the building.

In 1974, 555 California Street was again used extensively for filming of a box-office hit, this time The Towering Inferno, in which the outside plaza substituted for the film's fictional skyscraper, the infamous Glass Tower.

Together with the Transamerica Pyramid, 555 California Street is evidence of the direction San Francisco's downtown was moving during the 1960s before numerous campaigns against high-rise buildings in the 1970s and 1980s forced development to move south of Market Street.

Reference: Wikipedia.

photo.title: Bank of Light

description._content:
"555 California Street, formerly the Bank of America Center, is a 52-story, 779 ft (237.4 m) skyscraper in San Francisco, California. It is the second tallest building in the city and a focal point of the Financial District. Completed in 1969, the tower served as the world headquarters of Bank of America until the 1998 merger with NationsBank, when company moved its headquarters to Charlotte, North Carolina.

A 70 percent interest was acquired by Vornado Realty Trust from foreign investors in March 2007 with a 30 percent limited partnership interest still owned by Donald Trump, while continuing to be managed by the Shorenstein Company.

555 California Street was meant to be a deliberate and unambiguous display of the wealth, power, and importance of Bank of America. To that end, the center was handled by the architecture firms Wurster, Bernardi and Emmons and Skidmore, Owings and Merrill, with architect Pietro Belluschi consulting. The structural engineering was performed by the San Francisco firm H. J. Brunnier Associates. The skyscraper incorporates thousands of bay windows thanks to its unique design, meant to improve the rental value and to symbolize the bay windows common in San Francisco residential real estate. At the north foot of the skyscraper is a large plaza named in honor of Bank of America founder A.P. Giannini that is often shaded during the day, leading to it being criticized as cold and windswept by many.

Constructed:  1969
Use:  Commercial offices
Height:  237.4 m (779 ft)
Floors:  52"
--Wikipedia

photo.title: N30: climate justice blockade of Bank of America in San Francisco

description._content: Photos of earlier N30 rally and march www.flickr.com/photos/ari/sets/72157622914061974/ 22 people were arrested at the Bank of America building west.actforclimatejustice.org/2009/11/n30-international-d... dirtymoney.org 350.org beyondtalk.net Protest at Chevron HQ in San Ramon on Dec 7, 2009 west.actforclimatejustice.org/2009/11/december-7th-tell-c... Copenhagen Cafe is a place to gather Dec 7 - 18 during the climate conference for live coverage and workshops. Ground level Crocker Galleria, 50 Post St More info & schedule at carboncollaborative.org/?q=copenhagen-cafe 350 weekend of action Dec 11-13 at the mid-point of Coppenhagen. See www.350.org/map for more Bay Area events Friday December 11 Meet in front of Senator Feinstein's office on the corner of Post & Montgomery at 4 pm What: First, we'll deliver 350 photos from Oct. 24th and letters from participating groups to Senator Feinstein office (a delivery to Senator Boxer's office will happen earlier in the day). Then we'll have a candlelight vigil and march from Senator Feinstein's office to the Civic Center. At the Civic Center there will be speakers and we will also spell out 350 with our candles for a photo. The vigil is 5:30 - 7 pm, San Francisco City Hall Saturday December 12th The World wants a real deal Santas, elves, & reindeer will also gather to collect signatures on giant holiday cards asking for a real climate deal in Copenhagen. Noon - 5 pm, Union Square steps corner of Stockton & Geary sfoxfamactioncorps.org Wednesday, December 16th Rebecca & David Solnit discuss their book The Battle of the Story of the Battle of Seattle and Rebecca’s A Paradise Built in Hell 7 pm Modern Times, 888 Valencia St mtbs.com Passive/Agressive a day by @SoEx_SF of public art 11 am - 5 pm soex.org/Event/215.html

description._content: Photos of earlier N30 rally and march www.flickr.com/photos/ari/sets/72157622914061974/ 22 people were arrested at the Bank of America building west.actforclimatejustice.org/2009/11/n30-international-d... dirtymoney.org 350.org beyondtalk.net Protest at Chevron HQ in San Ramon on Dec 7, 2009 west.actforclimatejustice.org/2009/11/december-7th-tell-c... Copenhagen Cafe is a place to gather Dec 7 - 18 during the climate conference for live coverage and workshops. Ground level Crocker Galleria, 50 Post St More info & schedule at carboncollaborative.org/?q=copenhagen-cafe 350 weekend of action Dec 11-13 at the mid-point of Coppenhagen. See www.350.org/map for more Bay Area events Friday December 11 Meet in front of Senator Feinstein's office on the corner of Post & Montgomery at 4 pm What: First, we'll deliver 350 photos from Oct. 24th and letters from participating groups to Senator Feinstein office (a delivery to Senator Boxer's office will happen earlier in the day). Then we'll have a candlelight vigil and march from Senator Feinstein's office to the Civic Center. At the Civic Center there will be speakers and we will also spell out 350 with our candles for a photo. The vigil is 5:30 - 7 pm, San Francisco City Hall Saturday December 12th The World wants a real deal Santas, elves, & reindeer will also gather to collect signatures on giant holiday cards asking for a real climate deal in Copenhagen. Noon - 5 pm, Union Square steps corner of Stockton & Geary sfoxfamactioncorps.org Wednesday, December 16th Rebecca & David Solnit discuss their book The Battle of the Story of the Battle of Seattle and Rebecca’s A Paradise Built in Hell 7 pm Modern Times, 888 Valencia St mtbs.com Passive/Agressive a day by @SoEx_SF of public art 11 am - 5 pm soex.org/Event/215.html

Ground level Crocker Galleria, 50 Post St More info & schedule at carboncollaborative.org/?q=copenhagen-cafe 350 weekend of action Dec 11-13 at the mid-point of Coppenhagen. See www.350.org/map for more Bay Area events Friday December 11 Meet in front of Senator Feinstein's office on the corner of Post & Montgomery at 4 pm What: First, we'll deliver 350 photos from Oct. 24th and letters from participating groups to Senator Feinstein office (a delivery to Senator Boxer's office will happen earlier in the day). Then we'll have a candlelight vigil and march from Senator Feinstein's office to the Civic Center. At the Civic Center there will be speakers and we will also spell out 350 with our candles for a photo. The vigil is 5:30 - 7 pm, San Francisco City Hall Saturday December 12th The World wants a real deal Santas, elves, & reindeer will also gather to collect signatures on giant holiday cards asking for a real climate deal in Copenhagen. Noon - 5 pm, Union Square steps corner of Stockton & Geary sfoxfamactioncorps.org Wednesday, December 16th Rebecca & David Solnit discuss their book The Battle of the Story of the Battle of Seattle and Rebecca’s A Paradise Built in Hell 7 pm Modern Times, 888 Valencia St mtbs.com Passive/Agressive a day by @SoEx_SF of public art 11 am - 5 pm soex.org/Event/215.html

Copenhagen Cafe is a place to gather Dec 7 - 18 during the climate conference for live coverage and workshops. Ground level Crocker Galleria, 50 Post St More info & schedule at carboncollaborative.org/?q=copenhagen-cafe 350 weekend of action Dec 11-13 at the mid-point of Coppenhagen. See www.350.org/map for more Bay Area events Friday December 11 Meet in front of Senator Feinstein's office on the corner of Post & Montgomery at 4 pm What: First, we'll deliver 350 photos from Oct. 24th and letters from participating groups to Senator Feinstein office (a delivery to Senator Boxer's office will happen earlier in the day). Then we'll have a candlelight vigil and march from Senator Feinstein's office to the Civic Center. At the Civic Center there will be speakers and we will also spell out 350 with our candles for a photo. The vigil is 5:30 - 7 pm, San Francisco City Hall Saturday December 12th The World wants a real deal Santas, elves, & reindeer will also gather to collect signatures on giant holiday cards asking for a real climate deal in Copenhagen. Noon - 5 pm, Union Square steps corner of Stockton & Geary sfoxfamactioncorps.org Wednesday, December 16th Rebecca & David Solnit discuss their book The Battle of the Story of the Battle of Seattle and Rebecca’s A Paradise Built in Hell 7 pm Modern Times, 888 Valencia St mtbs.com

description._content: west.actforclimatejustice.org/2009/11/n30-international-d... 22 people were arrested at the Bank of America building dirtymoney.org 350.org beyondtalk.net Protest at Chevron HQ in San Ramon on Dec 7, 2009 west.actforclimatejustice.org/2009/11/december-7th-tell-c... Copenhagen Cafe is a place to gather Dec 7 - 18 during the climate conference for live coverage and workshops. Ground level Crocker Galleria, 50 Post St More info & schedule at carboncollaborative.org/?q=copenhagen-cafe 350 weekend of action Dec 11-13 at the mid-point of Coppenhagen. See www.350.org/map for more Bay Area events Friday December 11 Meet in front of Senator Feinstein's office on the corner of Post & Montgomery at 4 pm What: First, we'll deliver 350 photos from Oct. 24th and letters from participating groups to Senator Feinstein office (a delivery to Senator Boxer's office will happen earlier in the day). Then we'll have a candlelight vigil and march from Senator Feinstein's office to the Civic Center. At the Civic Center there will be speakers and we will also spell out 350 with our candles for a photo. The vigil is 5:30 - 7 pm, San Francisco City Hall Saturday December 12th The World wants a real deal Santas, elves, & reindeer will also gather to collect signatures on giant holiday cards asking for a real climate deal in Copenhagen. Noon - 5 pm, Union Square steps corner of Stockton & Geary sfoxfamactioncorps.org Wednesday, December 16th Rebecca & David Solnit discuss their book The Battle of the Story of the Battle of Seattle and Rebecca’s A Paradise Built in Hell 7 pm Modern Times, 888 Valencia St mtbs.com

description._content: west.actforclimatejustice.org/2009/11/n30-international-d... 22 people were arrested at the Bank of America building dirtymoney.org 350.org beyondtalk.net Protest at Chevron HQ in San Ramon on Dec 7, 2009 west.actforclimatejustice.org/2009/11/december-7th-tell-c... Copenhagen Cafe is a place to gather Dec 7 - 18 during the climate conference for live coverage and workshops. Ground level Crocker Galleria, 50 Post St More info & schedule at carboncollaborative.org/?q=copenhagen-cafe 350 weekend of action Dec 11-13 at the mid-point of Coppenhagen. See www.350.org/map for more Bay Area events Friday December 11 Meet in front of Senator Feinstein's office on the corner of Post & Montgomery at 4 pm What: First, we'll deliver 350 photos from Oct. 24th and letters from participating groups to Senator Feinstein office (a delivery to Senator Boxer's office will happen earlier in the day). Then we'll have a candlelight vigil and march from Senator Feinstein's office to the Civic Center. At the Civic Center there will be speakers and we will also spell out 350 with our candles for a photo. The vigil is 5:30 - 7 pm, San Francisco City Hall Saturday December 12th The World wants a real deal Santas, elves, & reindeer will also gather to collect signatures on giant holiday cards asking for a real climate deal in Copenhagen. Noon - 5 pm, Union Square steps corner of Stockton & Geary sfoxfamactioncorps.org Wednesday, December 16th Rebecca & David Solnit discuss their book The Battle of the Story of the Battle of Seattle and Rebecca’s A Paradise Built in Hell 7 pm Modern Times, 888 Valencia St mtbs.com

Ground level Crocker Galleria, 50 Post St More info & schedule at carboncollaborative.org/?q=copenhagen-cafe 350 weekend of action Dec 11-13 at the mid-point of Coppenhagen. See www.350.org/map for more Bay Area events Friday December 11 Meet in front of Senator Feinstein's office on the corner of Post & Montgomery at 4 pm What: First, we'll deliver 350 photos from Oct. 24th and letters from participating groups to Senator Feinstein office (a delivery to Senator Boxer's office will happen earlier in the day). Then we'll have a candlelight vigil and march from Senator Feinstein's office to the Civic Center. At the Civic Center there will be speakers and we will also spell out 350 with our candles for a photo. The vigil is 5:30 - 7 pm, San Francisco City Hall Saturday December 12th The World wants a real deal Santas, elves, & reindeer will also gather to collect signatures on giant holiday cards asking for a real climate deal in Copenhagen. Noon - 5 pm, Union Square steps corner of Stockton & Geary sfoxfamactioncorps.org Wednesday, December 16th Rebecca & David Solnit discuss their book The Battle of the Story of the Battle of Seattle and Rebecca’s A Paradise Built in Hell 7 pm Modern Times, 888 Valencia St mtbs.com

description._content: west.actforclimatejustice.org/2009/11/n30-international-d... 22 people were arrested at the Bank of America building dirtymoney.org Protest at Chevron HQ in San Ramon on Dec 7, 2009 west.actforclimatejustice.org/2009/11/december-7th-tell-c... Copenhagen Cafe is a place to gather Dec 7 - 18 during the climate conference for live coverage and workshops. Ground level Crocker Galleria, 50 Post St More info & schedule at carboncollaborative.org/?q=copenhagen-cafe 350 weekend of action Dec 11-13 at the mid-point of Coppenhagen. See www.350.org/map for more Bay Area events Friday December 11 Meet in front of Senator Feinstein's office on the corner of Post & Montgomery at 4 pm What: First, we'll deliver 350 photos from Oct. 24th and letters from participating groups to Senator Feinstein office (a delivery to Senator Boxer's office will happen earlier in the day). Then we'll have a candlelight vigil and march from Senator Feinstein's office to the Civic Center. At the Civic Center there will be speakers and we will also spell out 350 with our candles for a photo. The vigil is 5:30 - 7 pm, San Francisco City Hall Saturday December 12th The World wants a real deal Santas, elves, & reindeer will also gather to collect signatures on giant holiday cards asking for a real climate deal in Copenhagen. Noon - 5 pm, Union Square steps corner of Stockton & Geary sfoxfamactioncorps.org Wednesday, December 16th Rebecca & David Solnit discuss their book The Battle of the Story of the Battle of Seattle and Rebecca’s A Paradise Built in Hell 7 pm Modern Times, 888 Valencia St mtbs.com
